contentrichtext.text: {{For|Marvel Comics team of that name|Young Allies (Marvel Comics)}} {{Superteambox <!--Wikipedia:WikiProject Comics--> |image=Youngalliesdcu0.jpg |imagesize= |caption=The Young Allies, left to right Squire, Kuei, Fireball, Phantasmo. Artist [[Michael Bair]] |team_name=Young Allies |publisher=[[DC Comics]] |debut=''[[Young All-Stars]]'' #22 (January 1989) |creators=[[Roy Thomas]] (writer)<br>[[Dann Thomas]] (writer)<br>[[Michael Bair]](artist) |base= |members= |subcat=DC Comics |hero=y |villain= |sortkey=Young Allies (DC Comics) |}} The '''Young Allies''' are a team of [[DC Comics]] [[superhero]]es who operated during [[World War II]], created by [[Roy Thomas]], [[Dann Thomas]] and [[Michael Bair]]. The team and most of its members debuted in ''[[Young All-Stars]]'' #22 (January 1989). ==History== This band of young heroes first appeared on a morale-boosting mission to the United States in a story set in 1942. They were inadvertently involved in one of the All-Stars' cases when [[Axis Amerika]] attempted to steal plutonium from [[Albert Einstein]] and his colleagues in St. Louis (''Young All-Stars #22-26''). After this case, these heroes returned to their homelands and have not made any appearances in modern times. ==Members== Each member hailed from a country allied with the U.S. during World War II. Of the team's members, only the Squire originally appeared during the 1940s (''[[Batman]]'' #62), the others having been [[retcon]]ned (retroactively inserted into continuity). *'''Fireball''' - (Sonya Chuikov), from [[Russian Empire|Rus]][[Soviet Union|sia]], gained her power to wield fire after exposure to the [[Tunguska event]] on June 30, 1908. Her family was murdered during a [[Nazi Germany|Nazi]] invasion. *'''Kuei''' - (real name unrevealed) was a [[Republic of China (1912â€“1949)|Chin]][[Free China (Second Sino-Japanese War)|ese]] hero. This former soldier was shot during the war by a [[Empire of Japan|Japan]]ese soldier. Trying to end his suffering through suicide by drowning, he was possessed by a traditional Chinese demon called a [[Mogwai (Chinese culture)|Kuei]]<ref>[http://www.britannica.com/eb/article-9046355/kuei kuei - Britannica Online Encyclopedia<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> and transformed to look like it. *'''Phantasmo''' - (Jean-Marc de Villars), able to pass through solid objects, was a [[French Third Republic|French]][[Free French Forces|man]] descended from an earth elemental and a human man. Though he has not appeared since 1942, his postwar activities have been hinted at in ''[[Teen Titans|Teen Titans Spotlight]]'' #11. Note: This character was Thomas's homage to writers Randy and [[Jean-Marc Lofficier]]. "De Villars" is the name of a Catholic priest, the author of the occult novel, ''Comte de Gabalis''.<ref>[http://www.sacred-texts.com/eso/cdg/index.htm Comte de Gabalis Index<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> *'''[[Squire (comics)|The Squire]]''' - (Percival "Percy" Sheldrake) was the [[United Kingdom|English]] apprentice of the [[Shining Knight]]. After the War, Sheldrake took the code name of The Knight, and his son Cyril became the second Squire. In the 1950s, he was among the founders of the Dome (see [[Global Guardians]]; ''[[Infinity, Inc.]]'' #34). Cyril became a second Knight alongside the third Squire, his female ward Beryl Hutchinson, and they appeared among the newly-formed [[Ultramarine Corps]] (''[[JLA (comic book)|JLA]]'' #26). ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.dcuguide.com/who.php?name=youngallies DCU Guide: Young Allies] *[http://www.dcuguide.com/who.php?name=phantasmo DCU Guide: Phantasmo] *[http://www.cosmicteams.com/cosmic/a.html Cosmic Teams: The Allies] {{Justice Society of America}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Young Allies (Dc Comics)}} [[Category:DC Comics superhero teams]] [[Category:Justice Society of America]] {{DC-comics-stub}}
